author: Daniel Halper
title: Trump team outlines new plan to crack down on illegal immigrants | New York Post
text:
President Trump continued to roll back the Obama administration’s immigration policy, with the Department of Homeland Security issuing two new memos Tuesday.
The memos end Obama’s policy of “catch and release” of immigrants crossing illegally into the US, saying that the feds should “use our detention authority to detain folks.”
The new rules also call for Customs and Border Patrol and Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to remove illegal immigrants they encounter — with a special emphasis on removing those who have committed additional crimes while in the US.
“Department personnel have full authority to arrest or apprehend an alien whom an immigration officers has probable cause to believe is in violation of the immigration laws,” one document states.
“They also have full authority to initiate removal proceedings against any alien who is subject to removal under any provision of the (Immigration and Nationality Act),” it adds.
The memos further call for the immediate building of a border wall between the US and Mexico — a key Trump campaign promise — and the hiring of 5,000 Border Patrol agents and 10,000 ICE agents.
A current look at the US border in Puerto Anapra, Chihuahua state, Mexico. Getty Images “A wall along the southern border is necessary to deter and prevent the illegal entry of aliens and is a critical component of the President’s overall border security strategy,” one memo states.
US Customs and Border Protection officers at the San Ysidro Port of Entry border crossing in San Diego, California. EPA It adds that the Customs and Border Protection agency must “immediately begin planning, design, construction and maintenance of a wall, including the attendant lighting, technology (including sensors), as well as patrol and access roads, along the land border with Mexico in accordance with existing law.”
But the memos fall short of a full roll-back of Obama era policies. Not mentioned in either of the documents is the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) policy, which effectively gave reprieve to illegal immigrant children already in the US illegally.
Additionally, the memos do not call for National Guard troops to round up illegals, as a leaked draft memo last week stated .
